getBeanInstance

java.lang.Object getBeanInstance(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                 java.lang.Class<?> targetClass,
                                 java.lang.String mappingName,
                                 Definition definition)
Returns a bean instance.

Parameters:
type - the target class type of desired bean.
targetClass - the target class of desired bean.
mappingName - the mapping name if it exists.
definition - the definition of instantiating bean if it exists.
Returns:
the bean instance

isContainsConstant

boolean isContainsConstant(java.lang.String name)
Returns true if given name is existed as a constant.

Parameters:
name - the given name to be tested.
Returns:
true is it exists, false otherwise.

isContainsMappingName

boolean isContainsMappingName(java.lang.String name)
Returns true if given name is existed as a mapping name.

ex: attach(A.class).withName("Name").to(B.class).scope( Scope.SINGLETON);

Parameters:
name - the given name to be tested.
Returns:
true is it exists, false otherwise.

isPrototype

boolean isPrototype(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
Returns true if the instantiated beans whose Definition corresponding to given type are prototype-scoped beans. Otherwise returns false.

Parameters:
clazz - the given type.
Returns:
true, if checks if is prototype

isPrototype

boolean isPrototype(java.lang.String ID)
Returns true if the instantiated beans whose Definition corresponding to given ID are prototype-scoped beans. Otherwise returns false.

Parameters:
ID - the ID of definition.
Returns:
true, if checks if is prototype
